Description: A Technical Business Analyst (BA) is a professional who works with technical teams and stakeholders to analyze business requirements and translate them into technical requirements for the development of software applications. They have a deep understanding of the technical aspects of software development and work closely with developers, project managers, and business stakeholders to ensure that software products meet the business requirements. Technical BAs must have strong analytical, communication, and problem-solving skills, as well as knowledge of software development methodologies and tools. They are responsible for creating project documentation, communicating with technical and non-technical stakeholders, and ensuring that the project is delivered on time and within budget.

Required.SkillDescription: Experience in requirements analysis and the ability to translate business requirements into technical requirements
Experience in data analysis and the ability to analyze and interpret data to inform technical decisions
Experience in managing stakeholder expectations and communicating with customers, users, and other stakeholders
Strong understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC) and experience in implementing and managing this process
Ability to create and maintain technical documentation, such as user manuals, system specifications, and workflow diagrams
Experience in system integration, including the ability to integrate disparate systems and applications
Experience in data modelling and database design, including knowledge of data modelling tools and techniques
Experience in developing and integrating APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) to connect software applications and systems

Recommended.SkillDescription: Strong technical acumen and the ability to understand and communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Experience in modelling, analyzing, and improving business processes, using tools and techniques such as BPMN and Lean Six Sigma
Understanding of project management principles and techniques
A bachelors or masters degree in a relevant field, such as computer science, engineering, business administration, or a related field
Knowledge of cloud computing technologies and the ability to design and implement cloud-based solutions
Knowledge of cybersecurity principles and the ability to identify and mitigate potential security risks associated with software and systems
Strong understanding of Agile and Scrum methodologies and experience in implementing and managing these practices
Experience in data science techniques, such as machine learning, statistical analysis, and data mining, and the ability to apply these techniques to solve business problems
Experience in artificial intelligence (AI) techniques, such as machine learning, natural language processing, and computer vision, and the ability to apply these techniques to solve business problems
Knowledge of blockchain technology, including understanding of smart contracts and distributed ledgers, and experience in applying this technology to business problems
Knowledge of Internet of Things (IoT) technologies, and the ability to design and implement IoT solutions
Experience in UX design, including user research, wireframing, and prototyping, and the ability to design user-centered interfaces and applications
Experience in product management, including the ability to identify customer needs and translate them into product requirements
